question.content: As to where, if you have it in a game settings/preferences/options section under sounds, it could be set to music allowed: None/friends only/non muted/all or something similar. Open that setting window, change it to suit the moment.

referenced_message.content: Maybe, but now that's a new set of features too - where does that UI show up? What about blocked players? What about muted players? What kind of friction is there to quickly muting? Does the feature become mostly useless for 99% of people if most of them disable it in the first week due to trolls?

answer.content: FWIW: I'm asking these questions rhetorically. Mostly I'm making the point that said feature involves a lot more than one might think compared to "press button, play sound in multiplayer game", and as a general game dev bit of insight, that's why a seemingly simple feature can be far more complicated to develop. But this is true with practically everything. So we're doing these kind of "how do we do X, what else would it need, what else *wouldn't* we be doing because we spent this time doing X?" all the time.
